Label:
>>Before you start completing this application you will need:

*	A copy of the decree nisi or decree absolute from the divorce case.
*	Your PBA number or an online help with fees reference number.
*	A scanned copy of the draft consent order that has been signed by both parties.
*	A copy of the D81 form signed by both parties.
*	Any other relevant documents e.g. pension forms, cover letters etc.

Guidance on how to use the system can be found here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/myhmcts-how-to-use-online-financial-remedy-services
Keep the Applicant's contact details private from the Respondent?
#### SOLICITOR DETAILS
HintText: Create an application for financial remedy by consent

Label: Future email communications
HintText: I confirm I am willing to accept service of all correspondence and orders by email at the email address stated above.

Label: Case Number
HintText: Please enter 10 digit alphanumeric case number or 16 digit CCD case number

Label: What stage has the case reached?
HintText: To ensure the application is linked to the divorce file without delay, please upload a copy of the decree [nisi] [absolute]

Label: Keep the Respondent's contact details private from the Applicant?
Provision
HintText: Provision to be made to or for the benefit of the child(ren)

Label: #### DISCHARGE A PERIODICAL PAYMENTS ORDER AND TO SUBSTITUTE FOR IT
Discharge a periodical payments order and to substitute for
Applying for an order by consent
The application is for:
HintText: The applicant is applying for an order by consent in terms of written agreement (a consent order). Within the draft consent order, the Applicant is applying to Court for;

Label: Address details
HintText: If the application includes an application for a Property Adjustment Order in relation to land, please provide the address(es) of the property or properties, if applicable

Label: Mortgage details
HintText: If the application includes an application for a Property Adjustment Order in relation to land, please provide the name(s) and address(es) of any mortgagee(s), if applicable

Label: Does the application contain any application for periodical payments, or secured periodical payments for children?
Is there a written agreement?
HintText: If the application contains an application for periodical payments or secured periodical payments for children, has a written agreement made about maintenance for the benefit of children?

Label: Is there written agreement about maintenance for the benefit of children?
Select what the payments are for:
HintText: There is no agreement, but the applicant is applying for payments;

HintText: If Other, please provide details

HintText: If Other, please provide details

Label: Draft ${consentVariationOrderLabelC}
HintText: Please upload a scanned copy of the draft ${consentVariationOrderLabelL} that has been signed by both parties. PLEASE NOTE: Pension documents should be uploaded separately on the pension upload page or they will not be returned with a court seal upon approval of the application. Where possible, documents should be scanned in Black and White.

Label: Copy Draft Consent Order
HintText: If you are able to upload a text version of the draft consent order, it could reduce the time taken to provide you with a copy of the order, should the Judge approve it. The text version must be the same wording as the signed version you have uploaded but does not require a signature

Label: Are you uploading a joint D81?
HintText: You can either submit one joint D81 form for both parties or one for each applicant and respondent

HintText: Joint D81 form, signed by both parties

Label:
# Saving your application Once you have pressed ‘continue’ at the bottom of this page, you will have the opportunity to check your application and make any necessary amendments. To save a copy of the application, please press the ‘submit’ button at the bottom of the page. # What happens next Once you have saved a copy of your application, you will be directed to the case file. Here you can use the ‘Next Steps’ options on the top right of the file to administer the case. You will have the option to: * Authorise, pay for and submit the application Please note, your application will not be sent to the Court and your payment will not be taken until you authorise, pay for and submit the application. # If you need help You can contact the court if you need help. ************************************************************ Courts and Tribunals Service Centre PO Box 12746, Harlow, CM20 9QZ
Email: ContactFinancialRemedy@justice.gov.uk

# Sending your application to the Court Once you have pressed ‘continue’ at the bottom of this page, you will have the opportunity to check your authorisation and payment information and make any necessary amendments. When you are happy that the details you have entered are correct, please press the ‘submit’ button at the bottom of the page to send the application to the Court. # What happens next You will see a confirmation page showing that the case has been submitted and explaining the next steps in the process. # If you need help You can contact the court if you need help. ************************************************************ Courts and Tribunals Service Centre PO Box 12746, Harlow, CM20 9QZ
Email: ContactFinancialRemedy@justice.gov.uk

# Sending your documents to the Court

Once you have pressed ‘submit’ at the bottom of the next page, any documents you have uploaded will be sent to the Court. You will be able to see copies of these documents in the ‘solicitor response’ tab on the case file.
Please fill in the body of the text
